title: DHL Orders First Electric Cargo Planes to Slash Aviation Emissions
sub_head: The deal is part of its parent company’s plan to spend more than $8 billion by 2030 to meet emission-cutting targets
body:
European logistics giant DHL International GmbH placed its first order for electric cargo planes, marking one of the industry’s early deals for the emerging aircraft technology as carriers aim to cut their emissions to meet government climate-change ambitions.
DHL, based in Bonn, Germany, said Tuesday that it expects to receive a dozen fully electric aircraft from Eviation Aircraft Ltd. in 2024 for its DHL Express service. Arlington, Wash.-based Eviation said its Alice plane will make its first test flight this year.
